intro: Calycophysum pedunculatum var. villosum, commonly known as the hairy calycophyllum, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive floral structure and hairy foliage. It belongs to the family Calycophyllaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features small, clustered flowers with prominent calyces that often persist after flowering. Its leaves are typically ovate with a hairy surface, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks.
